unit_learning_outcomes.description: Formulate solutions to health system challenges
Critically evaluate a new health technology intervention using appropriate frameworks.
Appraise the safety and ethical concerns associated with the use of new technologies in public health.
Explain the fundamentals of public health informatics.
Interpret results from public health informatics studies, with considerations of the limitations.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Required reading prior to each lecture

assessments.description: Analysis of a public health informatics case study, focusing on the attributes of a surveillance system.
Students are required to keep a record of their reflections for each Unit of study so that they can keep a diary of their learning journey, to feed in to their Capstone Unit.
Online quiz consisting of multiple choice and/or short answer questions on introductory principles for public health informatics.

assessments.assessment_title: Public Health Informatics Full Day Workshop
assessments.description: Participation in workshop about technology and informatics applied to real-world public health practice.
Outline of an analysis of a public health informatics case study, focusing on the attributes of a surveillance system.

assessments.assessment_title: Evaluation of a Public Health Informatics System
assessments.description: Evaluation of a surveillance system or intervention in public health informatics.

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit aims to provide students with the knowledge and skills to navigate new and emerging technologies and explore their implementation in public health. The unit consists of three core components. In component 1, Public Health Informatics, you will gain an overview of technologies used in public health including machine learning, computer informatics, and mobile applications. In component 2, Evaluation, you will learn to assess the use of technology in terms of feasibility and acceptability. Component 3, Safety and Ethics, covers concerns and considerations when implementing new technology in health.

title: Public Health Informatics
